importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the game, October 20, 2025, marks when the Blue Jays and Mariners played Game 6, which resulted in a decisive win and forced a Game 7 in the ALCS, a pivotal moment in postseason baseball history.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The time frame from October 14 to October 20, 2025, spans the final games of the 2025 ALCS, culminating in a Game 7 that determines the American League champion for the World Series.

keyTakeAways: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit his sixth home run of the postseason, extending the Blue Jays' lead to 5-0 and contributing directly to the team forcing a Game 7.
The Seattle Mariners committed three errors, including two in the second inning, which led to early runs and ultimately contributed to their elimination from the ALCS.
Toronto Blue Jays become the first team since 1985 to reach a Game 7 in the ALCS, marking a historic moment for the franchise.
The winner of the ALCS will face the Los Angeles Dodgers in the 2025 World Series, with Game 1 scheduled for Friday, October 24, 2025.
Seattle’s pitcher Yesevage delivered a strong performance, throwing 31 splitters, striking out seven, and allowing only six hits and three walks, showcasing composure under pressure.
The Blue Jays’ victory was propelled by a combination of offensive firepower and defensive lapses by the Mariners, highlighting the importance of both aspects in postseason play.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He hit his sixth home run of the postseason, a key moment that extended the Blue Jays' lead and forced a decisive Game 7 in the ALCS.

namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Professional baseball team in Major League Baseball (MLB) based in Toronto, Canada
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Blue Jays won 6-2 against the Mariners, forcing Game 7 and marking their first ALCS Game 7 since 1985.

namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Professional baseball team in Major League Baseball (MLB) based in Seattle, Washington
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Mariners lost 6-2 to the Blue Jays, committing three errors and failing to score after the first inning, leading to their elimination in the ALCS.

namedEntities.name: Julio Rodríguez

namedEntities.name: Eugenio Suárez

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He reached second base due to a fielding error by Julio Rodríguez, leading to a run.

namedEntities.name: Ernie Clement
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He hit a groundball that resulted in a fielding error by Eugenio Suárez, leading to an early run.

namedEntities.name: Addison Barger

namedEntities.name: Isiah Kiner-Falefa
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He hit an RBI single after Barger, adding to the Blue Jays’ early lead.

namedEntities.name: Josh Naylor

namedEntities.name: Matt Brash

summaryOfNewsArticle: The Toronto Blue Jays defeated the Seattle Mariners 6-2 in Game 6 of the 2025 American League Championship Series, forcing a decisive Game 7. Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit his sixth postseason home run, extending the lead to 5-0 and sealing the victory. The Mariners committed three errors, including two in the second inning, which allowed early runs. Despite a single run in the sixth inning by Josh Naylor and a single by Randy Arozerana, the Mariners could not overcome the deficit. The Blue Jays’ win marks their first ALCS Game 7 since 1985, and the winner will face the Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series. The game highlighted both offensive excellence and defensive lapses, with standout performances from Blue Jays players and a strong pitching effort from Mariners pitcher Yesevage.
title: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hits sixth homer of postseason as Blue Jays dominate Mariners to force ALCS Game 7
